title: Fonts
narrative:
As part of the `UI` namespace, SwingTree ships with a custom `Font` class,
    which is an immutable value object containing a lot of properties and methods for
    working with fonts in Swing applications.

features.id: Use the `UI.font(String)` method to parse a font string.

extraInfo:
The `UI.font(String)` decodes a font string based on the following
            format: `family-style-size`. The `style` part is optional and can
            be one of the following: PLAIN, BOLD, ITALIC, or BOLD_ITALIC.
            You can also omit the size, in which case the default size of 12
            multiplied by the current look and feel's scaling factor is used.

features.id: The `UI.font(String)` method allows you to access fonts from a system property.

blocks.text: First we setup a system property
We use the `UI.font(String)` method to access the font
The font is correctly parsed

features.id: Simply pass the desired font name to the `UI.font(String)` to get a properly sized font object. [0]

extraInfo:
The `UI.font(String)` method allows you to quickly instantiate a `Font` object
            with the given font family name that has a default size of 12 multiplied by the
            current look and feel's scaling factor.

blocks.text: We first initialise SwingTree using the given scaling factor
A new font object based on the Buggie font family.
The font object has the correct family and size.

features.id: The `UI.font(String)` factory method can fetch fonts from system properties and apply the correct scaling factor. [0]

extraInfo:
The `UI.font(String)` not only parses font strings, but it can also fetch font
            definitions from system properties if parsing fails. When fetching fonts from
            system properties, the correct scaling factor is also applied to the font size.

blocks.text: We first initialise SwingTree using the given scaling factor
We setup a system property for a font
We fetch the font using the UI.font factory method
The font has the correct family, style, and scaled size

features.id: A SwingTree `Font` object has value semantics.

extraInfo:
Two `UI.Font`s with the same contents will be considered
            equal, and if they do not have the same contents, then they are
            not reported as equal by the `equal` and `hashCode` methods...

blocks.text: We create two reference fonts:

features.id: A SwingTree `Font` object has insightful String representations.

blocks.text: We create two reference fonts:
code: var f3 = UI.Font.of("Buggie", UI.FontStyle.BOLD_ITALIC, 17).with((Configurator<FontConf>){FontConf c -> c.strikeThrough(true)})

blocks.text: We create a font with "unknown" posture and weight...
The string representation will represent such unknown properties with a "?":

features.id: A SwingTree `UI.Font` can define text placement information for labels.

extraInfo:
On top of what a regular `java.awt.Font` has to offer in terms of properties,
            a SwingTree `UI.Font` also offers to configure text layout information in the form
            of vertical and horizontal alignment modes!
            These additional properties are used by some components, like labels for example,
            to place you text at a desired location in the component bounds.

blocks.text: We create various fonts with custom alignments:
code: var font1 = UI.Font.of("Buggie", UI.FontStyle.BOLD_ITALIC, 7).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->
var font2 = UI.Font.of("Ubuntu", UI.FontStyle.ITALIC, 13).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->
var font3 = UI.Font.of("Dialog", UI.FontStyle.PLAIN, 17).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->

blocks.text: A UI declaration where is font is assigned to a label:
The components report the correct alignment codes!

features.id: A SwingTree UI.Font can define text placement information for JTextPane components.

extraInfo:
The JTextPane component supports paragraph alignment through StyledDocument attributes.
            SwingTree UI.Font alignment properties are applied to JTextPane using StyleConstants.setAlignment().

blocks.text: We create various fonts with custom alignments:
code: var font1 = UI.Font.of("Buggie", UI.FontStyle.BOLD_ITALIC, 7).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->
var font2 = UI.Font.of("Ubuntu", UI.FontStyle.ITALIC, 13).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->
var font4 = UI.Font.of("Arial", UI.FontStyle.PLAIN, 12).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->

blocks.text: A UI declaration where fonts are assigned to text panes:
The text panes report the correct alignment through their styled documents!

features.id: A SwingTree UI.Font can define text placement information for JTextPane components reactively.

extraInfo:
JTextPane alignment should update reactively when the font property changes.
            This ensures dynamic alignment updates work properly with reactive programming.

blocks.text: We create various fonts with custom alignments:
code: var font1 = UI.Font.of("Buggie", UI.FontStyle.BOLD_ITALIC, 7).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->
var font2 = UI.Font.of("Ubuntu", UI.FontStyle.ITALIC, 13).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->
var font3 = UI.Font.of("Dialog", UI.FontStyle.PLAIN, 17).with((Configurator<FontConf>){ FontConf it ->

blocks.text: A UI declaration with a reactive font property:
The text pane starts with left alignment
We change the font property to center alignment
The text pane alignment updates to center
We change the font property to right alignment
The text pane alignment updates to right
We change back to left alignment
The text pane alignment returns to left

features.id: JTextPane alignment handles edge cases correctly.

extraInfo: Test edge cases like empty text, very long text, and alignment changes with existing content.

blocks.text: We create fonts with different alignments:
A text pane with empty content
A text pane with very long content
code: var longText = "This is a very long text that should wrap and demonstrate alignment behavior " * 10

blocks.text: Empty text pane has correct initial alignment
We change alignment on empty text pane
Empty text pane alignment updates correctly

features.id: JTextPane alignment is preserved when text content changes.

extraInfo: Verify that alignment settings persist when the text content of JTextPane is modified.

blocks.text: A font with right alignment
A text pane with initial content
Text pane starts with right alignment
We modify the text content
Alignment is preserved after text modification
We append more text
Alignment remains right-aligned

features.id: Text alignment for JTextPane components can be configured through the style API.

extraInfo:
The JTextPane component supports paragraph alignment through StyledDocument attributes.
            If you specify the alignment in the style API, then SwingTree will correctly install this property for you.

blocks.text: A UI declaration where text pane have their text alignment specified through the Style API:
The text panes report the correct alignment through their styled documents!
